The basement was not like most, looking like an actual living area rather than the cold, dark place most people think of it as. Timmy had been slightly bored all day, bouncing a tennis ball against the opposite wall for most of it. Once his fairies poofed into the room though, he smiled. "So, did she enjoy herself?" He asked, already knowing the answer.

"Yeah but, right before we left she asked you a favor." Wanda said, rubbing the back of her neck uncomfortably. "She asked if she could, keep, her wishes."

"Well, what did she wish for?" He asked, concern in his voice.

"Well, two things really. Never-ending cake and ice cream and the ability to never be full." Cosmo rattled off.

"Really, that's it?" The boy asked, a small smirk on his face. "That's nothing. I wish Tootie could keep her wishes!" He said, and so it was done. "I mean, what's the worst that could happen?"
